title: Samantha Brennan
text:
Samantha Brennan is a British-born <a href="philosopher">philosopher</a> and scholar of <a href="women%27s%20studies">women's studies</a> who is currently dean of the College of Arts and faculty member in the Department of Philosophy at the <a href="University%20of%20Guelph">University of Guelph</a>. She was previously a professor in the Department of Women's Studies and Feminist Research at <a href="University%20of%20Western%20Ontario">Western University, Canada</a>. She remains a member of Western's Rotman Institute of Philosophy and the graduate faculty of the Departments of Political Science and of Philosophy. Brennan was Department Chair of Philosophy at Western from 2002 to 2007, and 2008–2011. She is a past president of the <a href="Canadian%20Philosophical%20Association">Canadian Philosophical Association</a> (2017–18).
Education and career.
Brennan received her <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Arts">BA</a> in philosophy from <a href="Dalhousie%20University">Dalhousie University</a>, Halifax, Nova Scotia, and her <a href="PhD">PhD</a> from the <a href="University%20of%20Illinois%20at%20Chicago">University of Illinois at Chicago</a>, where she wrote her dissertation, "Thresholds for Rights", under the supervision of <a href="Shelly%20Kagan">Shelly Kagan</a>. Brennan grew up on the east coast of Canada, living in Newfoundland, New Brunswick and Nova Scotia. She was born in Lancashire, England.
Brennan has been a Visiting Faculty Fellow in Philosophy, RSSS, the <a href="Australian%20National%20University">Australian National University</a> and a Taylor Fellow in Philosophy and a Visiting Fellow in <a href="Bioethics">Bioethics</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Otago">University of Otago</a> in Dunedin, New Zealand.
Brennan co-founded "<a href="Feminist%20Philosophical%20Quarterly">Feminist Philosophical Quarterly</a>", an <a href="online%20journal">online</a>, <a href="open%20access">open access</a>, <a href="peer-reviewed">peer-reviewed</a> <a href="academic%20journal">journal</a> dedicated to promoting feminist philosophical scholarship.
In 2018 Brennan began a new position as Dean of the College of Arts at the <a href="University%20of%20Guelph">University of Guelph</a>.
Research interests.
Brennan's research focuses on contemporary normative <a href="ethics">ethics</a>, <a href="applied%20ethics">applied ethics</a>, <a href="political%20philosophy">political philosophy</a>, and <a href="feminist%20philosophy">feminist philosophy</a>. In work on <a href="children%27s%20rights">children's rights</a> and family justice, Brennan argues that adults should enter into parenting contracts rather than marriage contracts. In normative ethics, Brennan has developed a moderate deontological account according to which rights can be overridden on the basis of the amount of good that can be brought about by doing so. Brennan has also published on the topics of <a href="gender%20identity">gender identity</a> and <a href="fashion">fashion</a>, bioethics, <a href="philosophy%20of%20sport">philosophy of sport</a>, the moral significance of death, and on feminist approaches to fitness.
